## LinkedListElement

Linked list element class, contains data node and next pointer (element).

### Examples

```javascript
var elem = new LinkedListElement(15);
var elem2 = new LinkedListElement(30, elem);
console.log(elem2.next.data); // 15
```

### next

Type: [LinkedListElement][55]&lt;T>

## toJSON

Converts current element and all next elements in json format.

### Examples

```javascript
var elem = new LinkedListElement(30);
var elem2 = new LinkedListElement(15, elem);
elem2.toJSON(); // =>
{
 "data": 15,
 "next": {
   "data": 30,
   "next": null
 }
}
```

Returns **LinkedListElementStruct&lt;T>** valid json object.

## toJSON

Returns javascript root object form of the linked list.

### Examples

```javascript
var lList = new LinkedList(1);
lList.push(2);
lList.toJSON(); // => { data: 1, next: { data: 2, next: null } }
```

Returns **LinkedListElementStruct&lt;T>** Returns javascript root object form of the linked list.

## toString

Converts current element and all next elements in string format.

### Examples

```javascript
var elem = new LinkedListElement(30);
var elem2 = new LinkedListElement(15, elem);
elem2.toString(); // => 1530
```

Returns **[string][56]** valid string.

## toString

Returns string form of the linked list.

### Examples

```javascript
var lList = new LinkedList(1);
lList.push(2);
lList.toString(); // => "12"
```

Returns **[string][56]** Returns string form of the linked list.

## LinkedList

Main Linked List class, contains start node and basically the whole list.

### Examples

```javascript
var lList = new LinkedList(10);
lList.insert(20);
lList.insert(30);
lList.delete(30);
lList.toArray(); // => [10,20]
```

### length

Type: [number][57]

#### Examples

```javascript
var lList = new LinkedList(15);
lList.length; // => 1
```

### iterator

Standard Iterator.

#### Examples

```javascript
var lList = LinkedList.fromArray([1, 2, 3]);
for (const item of lList.entries()) {
  console.log(item); // => 1...2...3
}
```

Returns **IterableIterator&lt;T>** Iterables of element values.

### reduce

Reduces each element value using reduceFunction and returns final value.

#### Parameters

-   `reduceFnc`  
-   `initialValue` **T2** Optional, Accumulator/Initial value. (optional, default `0`)

#### Examples

```javascript
var lList = LinkedList.fromArray([10, 20, 30, 40]);
var sum = lList.reduce((acc, elem) => acc + elem); // => 100
```

Returns **T2** Returns reduced value

## insert

Inserts the given element at the end of the Linked List.

### Parameters

-   `item` **T** New element to be inserted.

### Examples

```javascript
var lList = new LinkedList(30);
lList.insert(15);
lList.insert(60);
```

Returns **[LinkedListElement][55]&lt;T>** newly added element instance.

## push

Pushes the given element at the end of the Linked List.

### Parameters

-   `item` **T** New element to be pushed.

### Examples

```javascript
var elem = new LinkedList(30);
elem.insert(15);
elem.insert(60);
```

Returns **[LinkedListElement][55]&lt;T>** newly added element instance.

## delete

Deletes the given element if present and returns element instance otherwise returns null.

### Parameters

-   `item` **T** New element to be pushed.

### Examples

```javascript
var elem = new LinkedList(30);
elem.insert(15);
elem.insert(60);
elem.delete(15); // => { data: 15, next: null }
elem.delete(50); // null
```

Returns **([LinkedListElement][55]&lt;T> | null)** Returns deleted elemnt or null.

## pop

Removes last element in the linked list and returns it.

### Examples

```javascript
var elem = new LinkedList(30);
elem.insert(15);
elem.insert(60);
elem.pop(15); // => { data: 15, next: null }
elem.pop(60); // null
```

Returns **([LinkedListElement][55]&lt;T> | null)** Returns deleted elemnt or null.

## has

Checks for given item in the entire list and returns true if available.

### Parameters

-   `item` **T** New element to be checked.

### Examples

```javascript
var elem = new LinkedList(30);
elem.insert(15);
elem.insert(60);
elem.has(15); // true
elem.has(50); // false
```

Returns **[boolean][58]** newly added element instance.

## traverse

Traverses the whole list and calls given callback function for each element.

### Examples

```javascript
var dataPrinter = (el) => { console.log(el.data); };
var lList = new LinkedList(15);
lList.insert(30);
lList.traverse(dataPrinter); // => 15...20
```

Returns **void** Returns undefined.

## entries

Returns an iterable of key, value pairs for element in the Linked List.

### Examples

```javascript
var lList = LinkedList.fromArray([1, 2, 3]);
for (const [index, item] of lList.entries()) {
  console.log(index, item); // => 0 1...1 2...2 3
}
```

Returns **IterableIterator&lt;\[[number][57], T]>** Iterables of index keys and values.

## each

Traverses the whole list and calls given callback function for each element.

### Examples

```javascript
var dataPrinter = (el) => { console.log(el.data); };
var lList = new LinkedList(15);
lList.insert(30);
lList.each(dataPrinter); // => 15...20
```

Returns **void** Returns undefined.

## forEach

Traverses the whole list and calls given callback function for each element.

### Examples

```javascript
var dataPrinter = (el) => { console.log(el.data); };
var lList = new LinkedList(15);
lList.insert(30);
lList.forEach(dataPrinter); // => 15...20
```

Returns **void** Returns undefined.

## map

Maps current linked list values to a new linked list with modifying the values using given callback function.
Uses BFS.

### Examples

```javascript
var lList = LinkedList.fromArray([10, 20, 30, 40]);
var lList2 = lList.map(n => n * 2);
var arr2 = lList2.toArray(); // [20, 40, 60, 80]
```

Returns **[LinkedList][59]&lt;T>** A newly mapped linked list.

## filter

Filters each item based on given filter function and returns new linked list.
If no value is filtered then returns null.

### Examples

```javascript
var lList = LinkedList.fromArray([10, 20, 30, 40]);
var lList2 = lList.filter(n => !!(n % 4 === 0));
var arr2 = lList2.toArray(); // [20, 40]
```

Returns **([LinkedList][59]&lt;T> | null)** New filtered instance of tree or null.

## get

Returns element at given location.

### Parameters

-   `index` **[number][57]** Index to find the element.

### Examples

```javascript
var lList = new LinkedList(15);
lList.insert(30);
lList.insert(45);
lList.get(2); // => 45
```

## toArray

Returns array form of the linked list.

### Examples

```javascript
var lList = new LinkedList(1);
lList.push(2);
lList.push(3);
lList.toArray(); // => [1, 2, 3]
```

Returns **[Array][60]&lt;T>** Returns array form of the linked list.

## fromArray

A static method, Creates a Linked List instance from given array.

### Parameters

-   `array` **[Array][60]&lt;T>** Array of elements.

### Examples

```javascript
var lList = LinkedList.fromArray([1, 2, 3]);
lList.length; // => 3
```

Returns **[LinkedList][59]&lt;T>** Returns new linked list instance with all elements in array.
